security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing educational content for Telegram bot development. All code examples are standard, legitimate API usage patterns targeting official Telegram endpoints. No malicious code, credential theft patterns, or suspicious network activity detected.

content.user_title: Build Telegram Bots and Mini Apps
content.value_statement: Need to create a Telegram bot or web app? This skill provides complete guides for Bot API, Mini Apps, and client development with practical code examples.
actual_capabilities: Create Telegram bots with Bot API and handle messages
Build Mini Apps with JavaScript WebApp SDK
Add inline keyboards and interactive buttons
Use TDLib for custom client development
limitations: Does not include executable code or scripts to run
Requires your own Telegram Bot token and API credentials
Does not cover backend hosting or deployment configurations
Mini App features require HTTPS and public URL

use_cases.title: Chatbot Development
use_cases.description: Create interactive Telegram bots for customer service, notifications, or automation tasks

use_cases.title: Mini App Creation
use_cases.description: Build web applications that run inside Telegram with native UI components and device access

use_cases.title: Payment Integration
use_cases.description: Add Telegram Stars payment system to accept payments within your bot or mini app

prompt_templates.prompt: How do I create a Telegram bot and send my first message using Python?

prompt_templates.prompt: Configure a Flask webhook to receive Telegram updates and respond automatically

prompt_templates.title: Mini App Development
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Telegram Mini App with main button, theme support, and data validation

prompt_templates.title: Advanced UI
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement inline keyboard with callback buttons and handle user interactions in python-telegram-bot

output_examples.input: Create a simple Telegram bot that responds to /start command
output: Use BotFather (@BotFather) to create your bot and get the token
Write the bot code with Application, CommandHandler for /start
Run with app.run_polling() to start receiving messages

best_practices: Always validate initData on the server side before trusting user data
Use environment variables to store your bot token securely
Implement rate limiting to avoid hitting Telegram API limits
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode bot tokens in source code or commit to version control
Do not trust client-side data without server-side validation
Do not make blocking API calls in handlers without using async properly

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Python, JavaScript, PHP, Go, Java, and C# have official Telegram libraries available

faq.question: What are the Telegram API rate limits?
faq.answer: Group messages max 20 per minute, private chats max 30 per second

faq.question: How do I validate Mini App user data?
faq.answer: Use HMAC-SHA256 with your bot token to verify the initData hash on your server

faq.question: Is my data safe in Telegram Mini Apps?
faq.answer: Mini Apps run in a sandbox. Store sensitive data server-side, use SecureStorage for local secrets

faq.question: Why is my webhook not receiving updates?
faq.answer: Check HTTPS certificate, public accessibility, and that the endpoint returns 200 OK quickly

faq.question: How is Bot API different from Telegram API?
faq.answer: Bot API is HTTP-based for bots only. Telegram API uses MTProto for full Telegram functionality
